item.title: 据当地媒体报道，中国电动车巨头比亚迪第一季度将在郑州招聘 2 万名员工
item.description: 据河南日报周四报道，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪计划第一季度在郑州招聘20,000名员工，涉及领域包括研发和制造。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD plans to hire 20,000 employees in Zhengzhou in the first quarter, in areas including R&D and manufacturing, government-run Henan Daily reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 随着 DeepSeek 的飞跃发展，俄罗斯储蓄银行计划与中国联合开展人工智能研究
item.description: 俄罗斯最大银行的一位高管告诉路透社，俄罗斯储蓄银行计划与中国研究人员合作开展人工智能联合项目，因为中国的 DeepSeek 公司以比美国竞争对手更低廉的成本创建了一个人工智能模型，从而颠覆了科技界的格局。【原文：Sberbank plans to collaborate with Chinese researchers on joint AI projects, a top executive at Russia's biggest bank told Reuters, as China's DeepSeek has upended the tech landscape by creating an AI model much more cheaply than U.S. rivals.】

item.title: 特朗普的 "微量 "取消对特穆来说是个坏消息，但对谢因来说更糟
item.description: 特朗普政府阻止低成本进口商品免关税进入美国的举措，对快时尚零售商Shein的打击可能比在线一元店Temu更大，因为Temu的产品种类更多，而且正在改变其运输策略。【原文：The Trump administration move to stop low-cost imports entering the U.S. tariff-free is likely to hit fast fashion retailer Shein harder than online dollar-store Temu, thanks to Temu's wider product range and moves to change its shipping strategy.】

item.title: DeepSeek 热助长了对中国人工智能股票的爱国押注
item.description: 中国投资者正在抢购与人工智能相关的股票，押注本土初创公司 DeepSeek 在人工智能方面的进步将带动该行业的繁荣，并使中国在愈演愈烈的中美技术战中占据主动。【原文：Chinese investors are rushing into AI-related stocks, betting the artificial intelligence advance of home-grown startup DeepSeek will lead to a boom in the sector and give the initiative to China in an intensifying Sino-U.S. technology war.】

item.title: 汉诺威再保险公司预计洛杉矶火灾索赔额为 5-7 亿欧元
item.description: 汉诺威再保险公司（Hannover Re）首席执行官让-雅克-亨乔兹（Jean-Jacques Henchoz）周四表示，洛杉矶地区的火灾可能会给该公司带来 5 亿欧元（5.1895 亿美元）至 7 亿欧元的索赔。【原文：Fires in the Los Angeles area may result in claims of between 500 million euros ($518.95 million) and 700 million euros for the reinsurer Hannover Re , the company's chief executive Jean-Jacques Henchoz said on Thursday.】

item.title: 安赛乐米塔尔将在美国新建钢铁厂以满足汽车行业需求
item.description: 安赛乐米塔尔公司（ArcelorMittal）周四表示，该公司将在阿拉巴马州卡尔弗特（Calvert）建造一座先进的钢铁制造厂，以提高生产能力，满足美国汽车行业的需求。【原文：ArcelorMittal said on Thursday that it would build an advanced steel manufacturing facility in Calvert, Alabama, as it seeks to increase its production capacity to meet demand from the U.S. automotive sector.】

item.title: 聚焦：为降低成本，2025 年中国的美国乙烷进口量将激增
item.description: 尽管华盛顿和中国政府之间的贸易战愈演愈烈，但今年中国从美国进口的乙烷量仍将激增，因为大型石化生产商正在与利润缩水作斗争，转而使用美国页岩气繁荣带来的廉价原料。【原文：Despite a growing trade war between Washington and Beijing, China's ethane imports from the U.S. are set to surge this year as big petrochemical producers battling shrinking profits switch to the cheaper feedstock flowing from the U.S. shale gas boom.】

item.title: 波音公司预计未来 20 年印度和南亚航空公司将增加超过 2,800 架喷气机
item.description: 波音公司周四表示，随着中产阶级的崛起和健康的经济增长刺激了旅行需求，预计印度和南亚航空公司在未来 20 年内将增加 2835 架商用飞机，比目前的水平增加四倍。【原文：Boeing said on Thursday it expects Indian and South Asian airlines will add 2,835 commercial aircraft to their fleet over the next 20 years, a four-fold increase over current levels, as a rising middle class and healthy economic growth spur travel.】

item.title: 高通公司股价下跌，原因是许可业务预期令人失望
item.description: 周四，高通公司股价在法兰克福下跌超过 3%，原因是其专利授权业务不增长的预期令人失望，给高于预期的销售和利润前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：Shares in Qualcomm fell more than 3% in Frankfurt on Thursday as a disappointing forecast for no growth in its patent licensing business overshadowed a higher-than-expected outlook for sales and profits.】

item.title: 马士基第四季度利润超预期，预计 2025 年盈利将放缓
item.description: 马士基周四公布的第四季度利润高于预期，并表示在宏观经济不确定性较大、可能影响全球贸易的情况下，预计今年的盈利将低于去年水平。【原文：Maersk on Thursday reported fourth-quarter profits above expectations and said it expects earnings this year to trail last year's level amid considerable macroeconomic uncertainties which could impact global trade.】

item.title: 亚洲股市 1 月份外资大幅流出
item.description: 由于美国国债收益率上升，以及对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）政府征收额外关税可能导致亚洲出口受损的担忧加剧，外国投资者在 1 月份大量撤出亚洲股市。【原文：Foreign investors pulled heavily out of Asian stocks in January, deterred by higher U.S. Treasury yields and rising concerns that regional exports could suffer under additional tariffs from President Donald Trump's administration.】

item.title: 啤酒生产商嘉士伯报告利润增长达到指导区间上限
item.description: 丹麦啤酒酿造商嘉士伯（Carlsberg）表示，其年度有机营业利润增长了 6%，达到了指导范围的上限，并预测本年度将进一步增长 1%至 5%。【原文：Danish brewer Carlsberg said its annual organic operating profit grew by 6%, at the top end of its guidance range, and forecast further growth of between 1% and 5% for the current year.】

item.title: 饮料集团 Pernod 下调 2025 年销售展望，原因是美国和中国市场面临挑战
item.description: 法国饮料公司保乐力加（Pernod Ricard）周四以美国和中国市场形势严峻为由，下调了 2025 年及更长期的业绩展望，并提前发布了上半年财报。【原文：French drinks company Pernod Ricard cut its 2025 and longer-term outlook on Thursday and brought forward issuing of its first half results, citing challenging market conditions in the United States and China.】

item.title: 亚洲第一大卫星公司：欢迎 SpaceX 在特朗普 2.0 时代崛起
item.description: 对于亚洲最大的卫星公司 SKY Perfect JSAT 而言，其总裁周四表示，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）第二次担任美国总统期间，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的火箭和卫星互联网巨头 SpaceX 的崛起并非逆风。【原文：For Asia's biggest satellite company, SKY Perfect JSAT , the rise of Elon Musk's rocket and satellite internet giant SpaceX under the second Donald Trump U.S. presidency is not a headwind, its president said on Thursday.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车第四季度利润下滑，为动荡的 2025 年做好准备
item.description: 总部位于瑞典的沃尔沃汽车公司周四公布第四季度营业利润下降，并预测 2025 年市场环境将充满挑战。【原文：Sweden-based Volvo Cars reported a fall in fourth-quarter operating profit on Thursday and predicted a turbulent 2025 with challenging market conditions.】

item.title: 欧洲央行警告：欧洲可能成为中美贸易战的最大输家
item.description: 欧洲央行董事会成员皮埃罗-西波隆（Piero Cipollone）表示，随着通胀放缓，欧洲央行的利率还有进一步下降的空间，他同时警告说，美国政府与中国的贸易战可能会对拥有 20 个成员国的欧元区造成不利影响。【原文：European Central Bank interest rates have room to fall further as inflation moderates, ECB board member Piero Cipollone said, warning that the U.S. administration's trade war with China could have a detrimental impact on the 20-member euro zone.】

item.title: 美元飙升刺激企业外汇套期保值激增
item.description: 企业财务主管们正在加大力度保护公司盈利，以防美元进一步走强，一些分析师表示，此举表明，他们更加相信唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税计划将有助于美元在更长时间内保持高位。【原文：Corporate treasurers are ramping up efforts to guard company earnings against more dollar strength, a move that some analysts said points to increased conviction that President Donald Trump's tariff plans will help keep the U.S. currency higher for longer.】

item.title: 欧洲央行希望特朗普的加密货币计划能加速数字欧元的发展
item.description: 欧洲央行董事会成员皮埃罗-西波隆（Piero Cipollone）告诉路透社，欧洲央行希望美国总统唐纳德-特朗普支持与美元挂钩的加密货币的计划能加快数字欧元的立法支持。【原文：The European Central Bank hopes U.S. President Donald Trump's plan to support cryptocurrencies pegged to the U.S. dollar will speed up legislative backing for the digital euro, ECB board member Piero Cipollone told Reuters.】

item.title: 中国对原油征收报复性关税可能导致美国 2025 年出口下降
item.description: 中国对美国的报复性关税可能导致美国石油出口在 2025 年出现下降，这是自 COVID-19 大流行以来的首次下降，而去年的增长已趋于平稳。【原文：China's retaliatory tariffs on the United States may cause U.S. oil exports to decline in 2025 for the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic, after growth plateaued last year.】

item.title: 早间竞价：焦点重回利率走势和公司收益
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 日本三菱公司 9 个月净利润同比增长 19
item.description: 日本三菱公司周四公布，截至 12 月份的九个月净利润增长了 19%，达到 8274 亿日元（54.3 亿美元）。【原文：Japan's Mitsubishi Corp posted on Thursday a 19% increase in nine-month net profit to December to 827.4 billion yen ($5.43 billion).】

item.title: 加拿大阿尔伯塔省部长称，在美国关税威胁下，该省将目光投向日本，寻求新的液化天然气交易
item.description: 加拿大环境与保护区部长丽贝卡-舒尔茨（Rebecca Schulz）告诉路透社，面对美国的关税威胁，加拿大主要天然气生产地阿尔伯塔省需要寻找新的出口市场，而扩大在日本的出口是一个重要目标。【原文：Canada's Alberta province, a major gas producer, needs to find new export markets in face of a U.S. tariff threat, and expanding in Japan is an important target, its minister of environment and protected areas, Rebecca Schulz, told Reuters.】

item.title: 约翰-舒尔曼离开人工智能初创公司 Anthropic
item.description: OpenAI联合创始人、去年加入Anthropic的约翰-舒尔曼（John Schulman）周三晚些时候表示，他已离开这家人工智能初创公司。【原文：John Schulman, an OpenAI co-founder who joined Anthropic last year, has left his role at the artificial intelligence startup, the company said late on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据朝日新闻报道，日产首席执行官内田告诉本田首席执行官三部希望终止合并谈判
item.description: 据《朝日新闻》周四在线报道，日产汽车公司首席执行官内田诚（Makoto Uchida）向本田汽车公司首席执行官三部俊博（Toshihiro Mibe）表示，他希望终止双方关于合并可能性的讨论。【原文：Nissan Motor CEO Makoto Uchida told his Honda counterpart Toshihiro Mibe that he wants to terminate their discussions over a possible merger, the Asahi newspaper reported online on Thursday.】

item.title: 沙特提价后石油收窄跌幅
item.description: 周四亚市早盘，油价从前一天沙特阿拉伯国家石油公司大幅上调3月份油价后的抛售中企稳回升。【原文：Oil prices ticked up in early Asian trading on Thursday, steadying from a sell-off the previous day after Saudi Arabia's state oil company sharply raised March oil prices.】

item.title: 贸易战风险消退，美元兑日元跌至 8 周低点
item.description: 周四，美元对日元汇率跌至八周低点，对英镑汇率则徘徊在一个月低点附近，原因是投资者对引发通胀的全球贸易战的紧张情绪有所缓解。【原文：The U.S. dollar slumped to an eight-week trough to the yen and lingered near a one-month low versus sterling on Thursday, as investor nerves about an inflation-stoking global trade war abated.】

item.title: 日本央行鹰派决策者敦促将利率上调至至少 1
item.description: 日本央行鹰派董事田村直树周四表示，日本央行必须在 4 月开始的本财年下半年将利率至少提高到 1%。【原文：The Bank of Japan must raise interest rates to at least 1% by the second half of the fiscal year beginning in April, hawkish board member Naoki Tamura said on Thursday, remarks that pushed up the yen as they reinforced bets of a near-term rate hike.】

item.title: 美联储杰斐逊不急于降低政策约束水平
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）周三表示，在政策制定者更好地了解特朗普政府的关税、移民、放松管制和税收政策的净影响之前，他满足于将央行的政策利率维持在目前的水平。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson on Wednesday said he is content to keep the central bank's policy rate in its current position until policymakers get a better sense of the net effects of the Trump administration's policies on tariffs, immigration, deregulation and taxes.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，OpenAI 将首次进军广告界，推出超级碗广告片
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，聊天软件制造商 OpenAI 预计将在周日的 "超级碗 "比赛中播放其首个电视广告。【原文：ChatGPT maker OpenAI is expected to air its first TV commercial during Sunday's Super Bowl, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国国务院称美国政府船只现在可以免费通过巴拿马运河
item.description: 美国国务院周三表示，美国政府船只现在可以通过巴拿马运河，无需支付费用。【原文：The U.S. Department of State said on Wednesday American government vessels can now transit the Panama Canal without charge fees.】
